tn.text: The word "Sin" here is the Hebrew name of the wilderness. It is not the English word "sin." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:16:01|16:1]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_transliterate]])
This means "the resting place," a place to rest on long journeys through the wilderness. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: Why do you quarrel with me? Why do you test Yahweh?
tn.text: Moses uses these questions to scold the people. AT: "You should not quarrel with me! You should not test Yahweh!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: To kill us and our children and our cattle with thirst?
tn.text: The people use this question to accuse Moses of wanting to kill them. AT: "You only brought us out here to kill us and our children and cattle by not letting us have any water to drink!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
a place in the desert whose name means "testing" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
a place in the desert whose name means "complaining" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This was the name of a place in the desert. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
Joshua represents the Israelites that he led into battle. AT: "So Joshua and the men he chose fought against the Amalekites" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
Hur was a friend of Moses and Aaron. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: Israel was winning ... Amalek would begin to win
tn.text: The words "Israel" and "Amalek" represent the fighters from those groups. AT: "the Israelite fighters were winning ... the Amalekite fighters would begin to win" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
The author writes of Moses' arms becoming tired as if his hands became heavy. AT: "arms became tired" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
The sword represents battle. AT: "in battle" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: I will completely blot out the memory of Amalek
tn.text: God speaks of destroying Amalek as if he were removing people's memory of Amalek. When a group of people is completely destroyed, there is nothing to remind people about them. AT: "I will completely destroy Amalek" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
People would raise their hand when they made a promise or pledge, so raising the hand represents making a promise. AT: "a promise was made" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "Yahweh lifted up his hand" or "Yahweh made a solemn promise" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This refers to the Amalekites. AT: Amalekites" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
